intro: Pedicularis pseudoversicolor, commonly known as the variable beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in alpine environments, thriving in rocky and well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Pedicularis pseudoversicolor is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
